question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Event Spam Prevention] Line 122 only emits OracleUnavailable if is_secondary_oracle_available to prevent spam in single-source mode - can attacker toggle secondary availability to suppress events? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Fallback Attack] Lines 125-127 fallback to secondary_price when primary stale - if attacker can DoS primary oracle, can they force system to use potentially manipulated secondary? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Price Switch] Line 127 assigns final_price = secondary_price - does this happen without any additional validation beyond freshness check? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [DoS Vector] Lines 128-130 emit event and return if both prices stale - can attacker DoS both oracles to prevent any price updates, freezing protocol operations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Stale Price Persistence] When both oracles stale on line 128, function returns without updating price - can old/stale prices persist indefinitely enabling exploitation of price-dependent logic? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Price Bounds] maximum_effective_price and minimum_effective_price retrieved on line 134 - if misconfigured with inverted values (max < min), does validation logic handle this? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Span Percentage Attack] maximum_allowed_span_percentage on line 135 - if set to 0 or extremely large value, can this disable historical price validation or cause false rejections? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Historical TTL Bypass] historical_price_ttl on line 136 determines how long historical prices valid - if TTL too long, can very stale historical prices pass validation? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [History Manipulation] config::get_history_price_data_from_feed() on line 137 returns (historical_price, historical_updated_time) - can attacker manipulate this historical data? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Validation Bypass] strategy::validate_price_range_and_history() on line 139 returns bool - if this returns false, lines 140-153 emit event and return - can attacker trigger false negatives to DoS legitimate prices? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Event Without Revert] Lines 140-152 emit InvalidOraclePrice event then return on line 153 - no revert occurs, just silent failure - can this hide critical price validation failures? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Timer Race Condition] Lines 156-160 update diff_threshold2_timer based on flag - if multiple concurrent update_single_price calls occur, can timer state become inconsistent? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Timer Reset Attack] config::reset_diff_threshold2_timer() on line 159 resets timer when prices normal - can attacker alternate between divergent and normal prices to repeatedly reset timer? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Timer Start Logic] config::start_or_continue_diff_threshold2_timer() on line 157 - does this properly enforce max_duration_within_thresholds to eventually reject divergent prices? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [History Overwrite] config::keep_history_update() on line 162 updates historical price with final_price - if called multiple times rapidly, can recent price history be lost? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Timestamp Inconsistency] Line 162 calls clock::timestamp_ms(clock) again instead of reusing current_timestamp from line 65 - can clock state change cause inconsistent timestamps? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Oracle Update Race] oracle::update_price() on line 164 updates the PriceOracle - if multiple feeds update same oracle_id concurrently, can last-write-wins cause price corruption? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Price Finality] Line 164 updates price after all validation - but if validation logic has bugs allowing bad prices through, this commits manipulated price to oracle - are all validation paths sound?
